column1: Then the king said to the young princess
column2: ‘As you have given your word you must keep it; so go and let him in.' She did so
column3: and the frog hopped into the room
column6: plash—from the bottom of the room to the top
column7: till he came up close to the table where the princess sat. ‘Pray lift me upon chair
column9: ‘and let me sit next to you.' As soon as she had done this
column12: that I may eat out of it.' This she did
column13: and when he had eaten as much as he could
column15: ‘Now I am tired; carry me upstairs
column16: and put me into your bed.' And the princess
column18: took him up in her hand
column19: and put him upon the pillow of her own bed
column20: where he slept all night long. As soon as it was light he jumped up
column22: and went out of the house. ‘Now
column26: and I shall be troubled with him no more.'
